file_content.text: Impressive, Jedi. You might even have triumphed, but my victory is already complete.
My plague has spread farther than you can imagine. Jedi Masters across the galaxy are succumbing to it as I speak.
The plague binds these Masters to me. Hundreds of them--the heart and soul of your order.
Free those Masters, Morrhage. Now!
Release them.
And if I refuse? Will you cut us down?
You've had thousands of years to think up that story.
That's a lie.
Then why hesitate, Jedi?
I don't care about your plague anymore. It's over for you.
So what?
Ha. Yes! Strike now!
Kill me, and you will kill every Master I have ever infected. Every one! Shielded or not, they are still bound to me.
But what choice do you have? You cannot let me live, and I am deathless. Your shielding talent cannot harm me. You've lost!
No matter what, Parkanas will be freed from you, Morrhage.
I can save you. [Shield him]
Ahhh!
No! This body is mine! Damn you, Jedi!
When my strength returns, no matter the years--I will destroy you!
I'm... still alive. You spared me.
Your life belongs to Herald now, dark thing.
I have to admit, I'm a little puzzled on that score myself.
My mind is... clearer now. But--it was your duty to kill me and destroy Morrhage.
Too many Jedi have been lost already. Including Parkanas Tark.
My duty is to save people.
Yes, Parkanas was lost. But perhaps he deserves another chance.
After what you've suffered, I imagine death was a welcome prospect.
You didn't want to live?
Maybe. But I'm still alive and... now I'm free.
A Sith could never understand the motivations of a Jedi.
You wouldn't get it.
I cannot return to the order. But... Tython has its hidden places, its forests. I could find peace there. I could... go home.
But first--Jedi, listen. Take this warning in exchange for my life.
You can't trust the order--or the Republic. You may be their heroine now, but they will abandon you too. Remember that.
You can't trust the order--or the Republic. You may be their hero now, but they will abandon you too. Remember that.
This plague must be stopped now. No matter the cost.
I have no choice. [Kill him]
Your mistake is thinking I care who dies.
So have you. [Kill him]
Aaargh!
Your power and tactics have got you this far, Jedi, but no further.
This battle was decided before you stepped aboard.
Lay down your lightsaber and I'll show you mercy.
Surrender.
Mercy is a weakness I have transcended.
I'm tired of your delusions. Explain yourself.
What do you mean?
There's nowhere left to run, Vivicar, and no more lackeys to do your fighting.
Your people are all dead.
They've served their purpose--delaying you.
My plague isn't just a disease; it siphons power from its victims. With the proper rituals, that power can be channeled.
Soon the combined strength of your Masters will make me the most powerful Force adept who has ever lived.
Turn away from this path, Parkanas. The order can help you.
Come home, to Tython.
Parkanas Tark died long ago. Even "Vivicar" is merely a skin to be shed.
I will not allow it.
If you love the Force so much, prepare to become one with it.
You'll die trying.
You can't defeat me, Jedi. This face, this "Vivicar"--he is just another skin to be shed.
Parkanas offered himself to me on Malachor Three, to crush the order that destroyed us. He embodied my spirit.
I am no lost Jedi, no ordinary Sith Lord. I am Terrak Morrhage.
Help me stop this monster, Parkanas, or you'll just be another of his victims!
Parkanas, don't let him win!
A Jedi healer put you down once. Now I can finish what he began.
You'll lose, Morrhage. Again.
Call yourself whatever you like. You'll die the same way.
It makes no difference.
No one can oppose me. I am beyond flesh, beyond death!
I will crush you, Jedi, and your shattered body will fuel my rebirth!
Tell me, Jedi, what was it like?
When you struck down a Master of your own order--was it as you imagined?
I acted to save innocent people, nothing more.
I never wanted to do it.
But killing a Jedi Master--any Sith would be proud of such an achievement.
I relished the challenge of the battle.
It was exhilarating.
Perhaps we aren't so different. But sadly, that won't save you--I have already won.
Letting your life force drain away, to shield a stranger from me--how did it feel?
It hurt. But I endured it.
I survived the pain.
Pain makes us stronger. And the pain I have endured is beyond your comprehension. That is why I have won.
Indulge me first. Tell me how it felt to fail miserably.
I enjoyed foiling you.
I cannot fail. In fact, I've already won.
You can't hide behind your minions forever, Vivicar. I will find you.
Come out and face me!
And then what? The battle is already fought, and I have won.
Hunt is not over until beast is skinned, dark thing.
Really? Because I'm almost positive I'm still alive.
If you need me to remind you of that, honey, just ask.
You will understand soon. If you live that long.
Ah. I wasn't sure if you'd be foolish enough to come aboard, Jedi. But I can sense your presence.
And I sense a man tormented by the past.
I feel sorry for you.
Did the docking starship clue you in as well?
That's hardly impressive.
Let's see if you handle a lightsaber as well as you talk.
I'm not here to chat.
You are blinded by the light side. You can't understand what you face.
Come to me, Jedi. I'll show you how light can be snuffed out.
There is darkness surrounding you. It's meager compared to mine.
Come to me, Jedi. Stand in the shadow of Malachor, if you can.
Still young and ignorant. You don't understand power, and now you never will.
Come to me, Jedi. See what a real master can do.
